info.name: Master Data
info.description:
SAP Business ByDesign API Samples - Master Data
===============================================

This Postman collection contains examples to query, read and manage master data using *SAP Business ByDesign Custom OData Services*.  
All sample data is aligned to and ready to run on *SAP Business ByDesign Partner Demo Tenants (Full scope US)* with preconfigured and loaded sample data provided by SAP.  
   

**Web services and User:**

ByD OData services require a SAP ByDesign business user for authorization. The OData requests in this collection use the following SAP Bydesign *Custom OData Services* assigned to the work center views in column *User authorization*. Assign the listed SAP ByDesign Work Center Views to your business user:

| Custom OData Service | User authorization (ByD Work Center View) |  
|----------------------|-------------------------------------------|  
| *khfunctionalunit* | *Organizational Management - Org Structures* |
| *khcostcentre* | *Organizational Management - Org Structures* |
| *khprofitcentre* | *Organizational Management - Org Structures* |
| *khcompany* | *Organizational Management - Org Structures* |
| *khbusinessresidence* | *Organizational Management - Org Structures* |
| *khbusinesspartner* | *Business Partner Data - Business Partners* |
| *khbusinesspartnerrelationship* | *Business Partner Data - Business Partners* |
| *khcustomer* | *Business Partner Data - Accounts* |
| *khsalesarrangement* | *Business Partner Data - Accounts* |
| *khsupplier* | *Business Partner Data - Suppliers* |
| *khemployee* | *Personnel Administration - Employees* |
| *vmumaterial* | *Product Data - Materials* |
| *vmumaterialvaluationdata* | *Product Data - Materials* |
| *khserviceproduct* | *Product Data - Services* |
| *khserviceproductvaluationdata* | *Product Data - Services* |
| *vmupricelist* | *Product and Service Portfolio - Price Lists* |

   

Additionally this collection uses the SOAP Web Service APIs:  
- *Manage Price Lists* 
- *Query Price Lists* 
- *Manage Accounts*
- *Query Accounts*
- *Manage Suppliers*
- *Query Suppliers*

Steps to configure SOAP the Web Service APIs:
1. Work center view *Application and User Management - Communication Systems*: Create a communication system
2. Work center view *Application and User Management - Communication Scenarios*: Create a communication scenario with web service APIs listed above
3. Work center view *Application and User Management - Communication Arrangements*: Create communication arrangement for your scenario of step 2, the communication system of step 1 and enter the credentials  
  



Organizational Structures
-------------------------

Organizational structure samples:
1. Get organizational units by role and function
2. Get functional units
3. Get companies
4. Get business residents (business object *PermanentEstablishment*)
5. Get cost centers
6. Get profit centers  
  

**Functions and functional roles of functional units**:

In general you can assign functions such as sales, personnel administration and cost management to organizational units. Functions reflect the involvement of an department in business processes. Functional roles are sub-types of some function codes. 

Example:  
- Function "*4 - Sales*" + functional role "*1 - Organization*" => The department acts as *Sales Organization*.  
- Function "*4 - Sales*" + functional role "*2 - Office*" => The department acts as *Sales Unit*.  
- Function "*6 - Marketing*" => The department is involved in *Marketing* processes.

In work center *Organizational Management - Org Structures*  you see these examples as functions "*Sales Organisation*", "*Sales*" and "*Marketing*".  
  

**Definitions**:  

Definitions describe the role of an organizational unit in the organizational structure. Possible definitions are *Cost Centre*, *Segment*, *Profit Centre*, *Reporting Line Unit*, *Functional Unit*, *Permanent Establishment* (= *Business Residence*).  
  

**Organizational unit assignments**:  

The sample OData services return organizational unit assignments for different definitions. The system determines each assignment based on the organizational structure. Hereby the leading question is always: "Which is the responsible organizational unit with the corresponding role". This means the organizational unit assignment can be the organizational unit itself (if it has the corresponding role respectively definition) or any other organizational unit depending on the relationships between organizational units.  
  
Example:  
The organizational unit P1110 has the definitions "Functional Unit" and "Cost Centre". Furthermore it belongs to the business residence P1100. Then the sample OData service *khfunctionalunit* returns the *CurrentCostCentreAssignment* P1110  and the *CurrentBusinessResidenceAssignment* P1100.  
 

You find more information about the organizational structure, functions and definitions in the ByD Help Center searching for "Organizational Management".
 


Materials (read)
----------------

Material samples:
1. Get material general data
2. Get material purchasing data
3. Get material logistics data
4. Get material planning data
5. Get material availablity confirmation data
6. Get material sales data
7. Get material valuation data (business object *Material/FinancialProcessInformation*)
8. Query and get material financial valuation data (business object *MaterialValuationData*)
9. Get material tax data  
 


Materials (write)
-----------------

Scenario:
1. Create material with general data
2. Add quantity conversion
3. Add supplier information and supplier part number
4. Add purchasing data
5. Add purchasing note and purchasing internal comment
6. Add logistics data
7. Update/add planning data
8. Add availablitity confirmation data
9. Add customer information and customer part number
10. Add sales data
11. Update/add valuation data
12. Add tax data  
 

Service Product (read)
----------------------

Material samples:
1. Get service general data
2. Get service purchasing data
3. Get service sales data
4. Get service valuation data (business object *ServiceProduct/FinancialProcessInformation*)
5. Query and get service financial valuation data (business object *ServiceProductValuationData*)
6. Get service tax data  
 


Service Product (write)
-----------------------

Scenario:
1. Create service with general data
2. Add quantity conversion
3. Add supplier information and supplier service number
4. Add purchasing data
5. Add purchasing note and purchasing internal comment
6. Add customer information and customer service number
7. Add sales data
8. Update/add valuation data (business object *ServiceProduct/FinancialProcessInformation*)
9. Add cost rate (business object *ServiceProductValuationData*)
 


Sales Prices
------------

Examples to create and change Price Lists and Discount Lists business objects using SAP Business ByDesign Custom OData Services and SOAP Services.  

Price Lists:
1. Create price list  of type *Net* pricing which are used in CRM documents like Sales Order, Service Order, Invoice documents...
2. Creates price lists with general information like Name, Valid From/To, Description, Currency along with Item information like Product ID, Amount and Price Unit data
3. Release the price list
4. Read the created price list , which gives general , item and scales data
5. Note : different types of price lists are created based on header and item keys passed during creation , example types of price list include base price list, base price list product category, distribution chain price list,distribution chain price list by product category, customer group price list, customer specific price list, campaign specific price list, company specific price list ...
6. Note : user can create custom price lists based in extension fields ( Key user / Partner extension fields ), in that case user has to pass the extension field as the key

Discount Lists:
1. Create discount list of type *Net* pricing which are used in CRM documents like Sales Order, Service Order, Invoice documents...
2. Creates discount lists with general information like Name, Valid From/To, Description along with Item information like Product ID, disoucnt Percentage data
3. Release the discount list
4. Read the created discoutn list , which gives general , item data
5. Note : different types of price lists are created based on header and item keys passed during creation , example types of discount list include overall customer discount, customer hierarchy specific discount, customer specific discount, customer specific discount product category ...
6. Note : user can create custom price lists based in extension fields ( Key user / Partner extension fields ), in that case user has to pass the extension field as the key

Price Lists (Gross):
1. Create price list  of type *Gross* pricing which are used in CRM documents like Sales Order, Service Order, Invoice documents...
2. Creates price lists with general information like Name, Valid From/To, Description, Currency along with Item information like Product ID, Amount and Price Unit data
3. Release the price list
4. Read the created price list , which gives general , item and scales data
5. Note : different types of price lists are created based on header and item keys passed during creation , example types of price list include base price list, base price list product category, distribution chain price list,distribution chain price list by product category, customer group price list, customer specific price list, campaign specific price list, company specific price list ...
6. Note : user can create custom price lists based in extension fields ( Key user / Partner extension fields ), in that case user has to pass the extension field as the key

Discount Lists (Gross):
1. Create discount list of type *Gross* pricing which are used in CRM documents like Sales Order, Service Order, Invoice documents...
2. Creates discount lists with general information like Name, Valid From/To, Description along with Item information like Product ID, disoucnt Percentage data
3. Release the discount list
4. Read the created discoutn list , which gives general , item data
5. Note : different types of price lists are created based on header and item keys passed during creation , example types of discount list includeoverall customer discount, customer hierarchy specific discount, customer specific discount, customer specific discount product category ...
6. Note : user can create custom price lists based in extension fields ( Key user / Partner extension fields ), in that case user has to pass the extension field as the key
   


Business Partner (read)
-----------------------

Material samples:
1. Query business partner by role
2. Get business partner with role "customer"
3. Get business partner with role "employee"
4. Get business partner with role "contact person"
5. Get business partner relationship of type "contact person" (business object *BusinessPartnerRelationship*)
 


Business Partner (write)
-----------------------

Scenario:
1. Create business partner with category "organization"
2. Create business partner with category "person"
 


Customer (read)
---------------

Customer examples:
1. Get customer general data
2. Get address information
3. Get tax data
4. Get bank details
5. Get customer responsible employees
6. Get sales data (business object *SalesArrangement*)
7. Get cross-account sales data (business object *SalesArrangement*)
8. Get contact person relationships (business object *BusinessPartnerRelationship*)
 


Customer from Business Partner (write)
--------------------------------------

Scenario:
1. Create business partner with category "organization" and the main address
2. Create customer from the existing business partner created in step 1 (as result the business partner gets the role "Customer")
3. Update customer general data and maintain customer-specific data
4. Create an addtional address
5. Add account note (text)
6. Create and activate a business partner with role "contact person"
7. Create a business partner relationship: The business partner of step 6 becomes a contact person of the customer created in step 1/2
8. Add customer responsible person
9. Add tax data
10. Add bank data
11. Activate the customer
12. Create customer sales data (business object *SalesArrangement*)
 


Customer (SOAP Web Service APIs) 
--------------------------------

In most system integration and replication scenarios it is more efficient to use SOAP Web Service APIs to query/read and create/update business partners, customers, suppliers, contact persons and service agents.  
This folder contains two customer examples.  
 


Supplier (read)
---------------

Supplier examples:
1. Get supplier general data
2. Get address information
3. Get bank details
4. Get tax data
5. Get purchasing data
6. 3 variants to query, search and get supplier by tax number
 


Supplier (SOAP Web Service APIs) 
--------------------------------

In most system integration and replication scenarios it is more efficient to use SOAP Web Service APIs to query/read and create/update business partners, customers, suppliers, contact persons and service agents.  
This folder contains two supplier examples.  
 


Employee and Position
---------------------

Examples:
1. Get employee with user and workplace address information
2. Get employee assignment and position in the organizational structure

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
   <soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <glob:SalesPriceListBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
 		<SalesPriceList ActionCode="04">
		  <TypeCode>7PL0</TypeCode>  <!-- 7PL0 for Price List -->
		  <ID>MD-1</ID>
		  <Description languageCode="EN">Base price list</Description>
		  
		  <!-- No Header Keys -->
		  
		  <StartDate>2000-02-02</StartDate>
		  <EndDate>2000-02-02</EndDate>
		  <CurrencyCode>USD</CurrencyCode>		  
		  <PriceSpecification>
			   <TypeCode>7PR1</TypeCode>  <!-- 7PR1 for Price -->
			   <Amount currencyCode="EUR">200.00</Amount>
			   <BaseQuantity unitCode="EA">1</BaseQuantity>
			   <BaseQuantityTypeCode>EA</BaseQuantityTypeCode>
			   <ProductID>{{ProductID}}</ProductID>
			   <ProductTypeCode>1</ProductTypeCode>   <!-- 1 means Material , 2 Means Service Product -->
		  </PriceSpecification>
		 </SalesPriceList>

      </glob:SalesPriceListBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

exec: pm.test("Get Base Price List  - Response OK", function () {

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
    <soapenv:Header/>
    <soapenv:Body>
        <glob:CustomerBundleMaintainRequest_sync_V1>
            <BasicMessageHeader>
                <!--<UUID></UUID>-->
            </BasicMessageHeader>
            <Customer actionCode="01" textListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="true">
                <!--<InternalID>{{C-CustomerID}}</InternalID-->
                <CategoryCode>1</CategoryCode>
                <ProspectIndicator>false</ProspectIndicator>
                <CustomerIndicator>true</CustomerIndicator>
                <LifeCycleStatusCode>2</LifeCycleStatusCode>
                <!-- set the status during Create -->
                <!-- General data -->
                <Person>
                    <FormOfAddressCode>0002</FormOfAddressCode>
                    <AcademicTitleCode>0003</AcademicTitleCode>
                    <GivenName>Carl</GivenName>
                    <MiddleName></MiddleName>
                    <FamilyName>Fjllstrm</FamilyName>
                    <BirthName></BirthName>
                    <NickName></NickName>
                    <NameFormatCountryCode>US</NameFormatCountryCode>
                    <GenderCode>1</GenderCode>
                    <BirthDate>1974-07-27</BirthDate>
                    <NonVerbalCommunicationLanguageCode>EN</NonVerbalCommunicationLanguageCode>
                    <OccupationCode>0017</OccupationCode>
                </Person>
                <VerbalCommunicationLanguageCode>EN</VerbalCommunicationLanguageCode>
                <ContactAllowedCode>3</ContactAllowedCode>
                <LegalCompetenceIndicator>true</LegalCompetenceIndicator>
                <ABCClassificationCode>A</ABCClassificationCode>
                <NielsenRegionCode>01</NielsenRegionCode>
                <IndustrialSectorCode>11</IndustrialSectorCode>
                <!-- Maintain adress -->
                <AddressInformation actionCode="01" addressUsageListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="true">
                    <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>002</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
                    <AddressUsage actionCode="01">
                        <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>003</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
                        <AddressUsageCode>XXDEFAULT</AddressUsageCode>
                        <DefaultIndicator>false</DefaultIndicator>
                    </AddressUsage>
                    <Address actionCode="01" telephoneListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="true">
                        <PreferredCommunicationMediumTypeCode>LET</PreferredCommunicationMediumTypeCode>
                        <EmailURI>carl.fjaellstroem@bydmail.com</EmailURI>
                        <FacsimileFormattedNumberDescription>+1 (716) 482-48100</FacsimileFormattedNumberDescription>
                        <PostalAddress>
                            <CountryCode>US</CountryCode>
                            <RegionCode listID="US">NY</RegionCode>
                            <CityName>Buffalo</CityName>
                            <StreetPostalCode>14204</StreetPostalCode>
                            <StreetName>Seneca Street</StreetName>
                            <HouseID>147</HouseID>
                            <TaxJurisdictionCode listID="US">NY</TaxJurisdictionCode>
                            <TimeZoneCode>EST</TimeZoneCode>
                        </PostalAddress>
                        <Telephone>
                            <FormattedNumberDescription>+1 (716) 482-48101</FormattedNumberDescription>
                            <MobilePhoneNumberIndicator>true</MobilePhoneNumberIndicator>
                        </Telephone>
                        <Telephone>
                            <FormattedNumberDescription>+1 (716) 482-48103</FormattedNumberDescription>
                            <MobilePhoneNumberIndicator>false</MobilePhoneNumberIndicator>
                        </Telephone>
                        <WebURI>https://www.sap.com/community/topics/business-bydesign.html</WebURI>
                    </Address>
                </AddressInformation>
                <!-- Create relations to existing business partners -->
                <Relationship actionCode="01">
                    <RelationshipBusinessPartnerInternalID>CP100110</RelationshipBusinessPartnerInternalID>
                    <RoleCode>BURC01-1</RoleCode>
                    <!-- "is Shareholder of" -->
        
                </Relationship>
                <Relationship actionCode="01">
                    <RelationshipBusinessPartnerInternalID>CP100110</RelationshipBusinessPartnerInternalID>
                    <RoleCode>CRMH20-2</RoleCode>
                    <!-- "Is Contract Release Authorized Party For of" -->
        
                </Relationship>
                <!-- Add account notes, financial data notes or internal/external sales notes -->
                <Text actionCode="01">
                    <ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>019</ObjectNodeSenderTechnicalID>
                    <TypeCode>10034</TypeCode>
                    <!-- Account note -->
                    <ContentText>Some text...</ContentText>
                </Text>
                <!-- Maintain customer attachmens like documents, images, links... -->
                <AttachmentFolder DocumentListCompleteTransmissionIndicator="true" ActionCode="01">
                    <!-- Link attachment-->
                    <Document ActionCode="01">
                        <VisibleIndicator>true</VisibleIndicator>
                        <CategoryCode>3</CategoryCode>
                        <TypeCode>10001</TypeCode>
                        <Name>SAP ByDesign Community</Name>
                        <AlternativeName>SAP ByDesign Community</AlternativeName>
                        <Description>SAP Community for SAP Business ByDesign</Description>
                        <ExternalLinkWebURI>https://www.sap.com/community/topics/business-bydesign.html</ExternalLinkWebURI>
                        <FileContentURI></FileContentURI>
                    </Document>
                </AttachmentFolder>
                <DuplicateCheckApplyIndicator>false</DuplicateCheckApplyIndicator>
            </Customer>
        </glob:CustomerBundleMaintainRequest_sync_V1>
    </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
